Posts.Content: SaxxyD is right that nails will recover...only problem is whether you want to wait!! nails grow quite slowly so it can be best to stop the problems earlier on.Â  There's been quite a lot of talk about the best products to use recently in the forum - here's my quick summary Onicolife drops - from www.mosaiclife.co.uk (they also do a good fact sheet on nail care during chemo) - good for yellowing and brittleness and sore nails evonail - online from farmaline - comes from Europe I think, but quite quick to arrive emu oil - can get on amazon paint with dark nail varnish - sometimes can help with photosensitivity, but seems mixed views on this ...and last thing, you mention numbness. docetaxel can also cause peripheral neuropathy so I think it is well worth telling your onc or nurse about these symptoms. F x
Posts.Title: Nail problem from chemo - urgent advice please?

Posts.Content: Hi There are some new drops you can now get for painful brittle nails, called onicolife. Here's where I found more information. My BC nurse told me about them...There are also tips on looking after nails during chemo. Docetaxel is a big cause of nail problems, it will get better after chemo stops but can go on for ages for some people....me for one, but all brill now http://mosaiclife.co.uk/symptoms/nails/onicolife-drop . good luck All best wishes F x
